solution_line_template: Mrs. Brown has a ${original_price} x {initial_discount_percent_num}/{percent_divisor} = $<<{original_price}*{initial_discount_percent_num}/{percent_divisor}={initial_discount_amount}>>{initial_discount_amount} discount for her purchase.

So, the remaining amount she needs to pay is ${original_price} - ${initial_discount_amount} =$<<{original_price}-{initial_discount_amount}={price_after_initial_discount}>>{price_after_initial_discount}.

But Mrs. Brown can still avail of the 5% discount, so she has an additional discount of ${price_after_initial_discount} x {additional_discount_percent_num}/{percent_divisor} = $<<{price_after_initial_discount}*{additional_discount_percent_num}/{percent_divisor}={additional_discount_amount}>>{additional_discount_amount}.
Therefore, Mrs. brown will only pay ${price_after_initial_discount} - ${additional_discount_amount} = $<<{price_after_initial_discount}-{additional_discount_amount}={final_price}>>{final_price}.
